page.title: 19My House By Emma Sykes
page.content: I live in a house in Holloway two hundred years old .It was originally two cottages and later changed into a public house and more recently converted into one large house. It has three double bedrooms,with a long corridor connecting one bedroom to the landing, one bathroom and a large loft area. It has four rooms downstairs and two staircases though one of these was removed to make more space in the kitchen. In about{1979}we added a porch and playroom . Most of the windows still have shutters and some of the rooms have their wooden ceiling beams exposed. The downstairs rooms have largeish ingle-nook style fireplaces and at one time a cast iron range could be found in the kitchen. The original doors, some of which still exist were made from tongue and groove planking.
